website_summaries.verdict: The Kingston 64GB microSDXC card's uneven performance puts it behind the competition.
pros: Comes with full sized SD adapter
Fast sequential read/write speeds in a phone
cons: Poor random write speeds on a PC and phone, and low copying speeds from a Mac

customer_reviews.title: Compatible with TomTom GO 5000
customer_reviews.text: My TomTom GO 5000 accepted this 32Gb card OK. Insert the microSDHC in the TomTom memory card slot. Connect TomTom to a computer (via USB cable). TomTom should switch on and detect memory card automatically and may prompt to format the card. There are two possible options: 1. use it for Maps or 2. use it for Routes If not prompted to format, select Main Menu > Settings > System > Format memory card. To install map on memory card connect TomTom to computer running TomTom MyDrive app. Select update. Maps take about 10 minutes to download and 90 minutes to install, so no different to using the internal (and inadequate) memory included with the device.
customer_reviews.author: Dave C

customer_reviews.title: Not a good day in Disc-land
customer_reviews.text: Using this card with my computer, I had nothing but problems, from the word Go. Every time I tried to copy a gig of music or pictures, it would just Stop dead after only a few Mb of data. SanDisc offered to replace it but not before I had to jump through hoops. They asked me to try in several devices, but I said that I shouldn't have to. Took a lot of 'tooing and froing' to get a replacement. Same result. After about the third card and many weeks later, I didn't bother sending it back. I was very disappointed, considering SanDisc must be one of, if not The most famous brand. John
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good value storage card
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this card to use with my Android Xiaomi phone. As it only had 8gb internal memory and with all the apps from google play, it was nowhere near enough space. I did have to re-format it as my phone normally only takes 32GB. Not the fault of the card at all. Once done, it was all fine and have been using it with no problems ever since. Speed wise, I haven't really tested it as it just been recording videos and so forth on the device. I have used Sandisk cards also and I don't seem to find much difference between the two. It has worked fine for me and I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: boutte69

customer_reviews.title: Not For Use In A Motorola Moto G5 Phone
customer_reviews.text: To cut a long story short, if you buy this and format it for use as internal memory on a Moto G5, it will (surprisingly) caused the camera app (and possibly other apps too) to run *extremely* slowly. Before the card was installed, when you pressed the 'shutter' it instantly took a photo, after the install (not exaggerating) it took approx 4 seconds between the press and the photo actually being taken which made it pretty much unusable. After reading some forum posts about it, I bought the SanDisk extreme Class 10 U3 32GB card, thinking this couldn't possibly make a huge difference, but it did. So now you know.
customer_reviews.author: Not A Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A good old 'un you can trust.
customer_reviews.text: Kingston has been around for a very long time, and the reason is that their products are reliable. If you have a glitch with the first formatting, plug it into another device, format it and then swap it back. You may find a problem with Sony low priced camcorders, but they work well with professional video cameras. Format it in a professional Sony video camera and it will work in any Sony camera. This device is dated, but compatible with older equipment. It is ideal for Casablanca video editors e.g. It will prove reliable, like it's supplier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useless Micro Sd card
customer_reviews.text: This micro sd card was absolutely useless, unpacked it, inserted into the cctv camera and it wouldn't even recognise it let alone format it or be able to use it on anything else. Surprised me because you thought being a sandisc it would work, but it was dead as a dodo. The company I purchased it from wouldn't even respond to my email, just took the money and left me without a working micro sd card. Do not buy this card.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. P. R. Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Great value for price!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this microSDHC card to use with Raspberry Pi. I already own Kingston microSDHC card but different size (8GB). I needed different capacity so I have decided to go for this one. I already have microSD USB adapter so I did not need the adapter, that comes with this card. I'm also aware, that some people might not have it, so it is a nice bundle. It worked perfectly when plugged to my PC and now works perfectly under Linux on my Pi. I have owned Kingston devices before and I do not recall any problems with them. I'm very happy with his card as well and I would recommend it to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Pan Kleks

customer_reviews.title: Unusual duff card from Kingston
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I've had this 18months and its not had hardly any use at all, perhaps once or twice a week listening to music via MotoG4. Today I couldn't get my pc to recognise it to transer files in but bizarrely could get some photos off it. I tested against Windows 10 and linux, both failed. Tried adapter to read direct into pc but not even found in the usb. So basically its a very flimsy card. I've other cards from Kingston (micro 16gb) and 32gb normal size with no problems, avoid this.
customer_reviews.author: Bazm

customer_reviews.title: Windows flaw
customer_reviews.text: FYI When using a Windows machine, any memory card above 32gb needs to be formatted using a third party piece of software. Use your search engine and make sure it is a legitimate provider. Usually the basic version is free and any additional software offered can be turned down. So far the 64gb card is working fine.
customer_reviews.author: baz cargo

customer_reviews.title: This Micro SDHC card does what it is suppose to do, store photos and video's.
customer_reviews.text: When I want to use them in my computer or my camera I just pop the Micro SDHC card into the adapter and I can use it where ever I want. I feel safe storing my data on a Kingston product. They are an excellent company with a wonderful performance record. I have purchased their products many times in the past and I will purchase more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Muhammad Sajjad

customer_reviews.title: Not 32GB
customer_reviews.text: The product is fine and works as I had wanted it to, but there is not 32gb of space on this card. Before I had even used the card and it was empty there was only 29gb on it. I'm not used to buying external memory and perhaps this is the norm, but when ordering I expected to get the size that was advertised, not 3GB less.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly in GoPro HERO4 Session
customer_reviews.text: I am using this microSD card within my GoPro HERO4 Session. Despite it not being listed in the GoPro card list, I haven't ran into any troubles with it so far. I assume this will be sufficient for most GoPro devices apart from the HERO4 Black which records at a very high bitrate. Works fast and reliably and it is easy to transfer onto the computer to edit my footage. Nice touch to include the adapter as well so I don't have to buy my own. Very good product and I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: tomwkli

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased a number of memory cards over the years most of which have been lower cost non branded ones, however I have found these do not last very long as they become corrupted and not able to be read. I purchased the Kingston card due to its reputation for reliability and it has proven to be the right decision as its still going strong. If you want a memory card you can trust to keep you pictures safe then is in a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Smoking Panda

customer_reviews.title: Straightforward, happy days
customer_reviews.text: Straightforward installation into my Huawei Honor 7x smartphone. I purchased the 32gb variant which needed no formatting prior to use. Just plug and play. My phone did notify me that the card was a lower class than class 10 and therefore would impact performance however I'll only be storing music and perhaps excess photos for viewing purposes really. So far it's working as intended.
customer_reviews.author: Dumi

customer_reviews.title: Functional but not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to use in my Raspberry Pi (32gb model), this worked fine for that purpose. However when formatting the card to put installation media on it, the memory system only showed 28gb, which didn't change even after formatting. There was also additional print on the cards (adapter and the micro) saying 'China' so I can only assume that these are binned units which have faulty memory or something along those lines. Though I don't mind as it was still relatively cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad.
customer_reviews.text: This performs to spec, if only barely - delivers about 10.6MB/s write, over 30MB/s read times. Certainly not as good as my 32GB Transcend class 10 micro SD card, which writes at about 13.5MB/s on average. The Kingston card also seems to be heavily optimised towards FAT and exFAT file systems, delivering its best performance with these, while managing only 5-7MB/s with others, particularly journaled filesystems. Again, the Transcend card performs much better with these as well. All in all, it delivers (barely) what it promises.
customer_reviews.author: omelette

customer_reviews.title: Quality at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: at a 1/4 of the price of the same card from Maplin (I think Kingston are generic manufacturers of SD cards) these are cheap (but not inferior) storage for my car dash cam. It means you can archive footage for a couple of weeks before you either capture to PC or re-format. They had no issues with either my dash cam or my camera, so you get more than you pay for (and buying 3 means they are post-free too; my Aberdonian granny is blissful in her grave
customer_reviews.author: R. McNaught

customer_reviews.title: Great value memory
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as advertised. If anyone is thinking of buying these for use with a Raspberry Pi computer - I was pleased to find that when I bought several of these together they all arrived with EXACTLY the same capacity, which is very helpful if you want to copy a 'disk image' between SD cards. Also tested the in my camera and read/write from my laptop - they work fine..... as you would expect from kingston.
customer_reviews.author: M. B. Davison

customer_reviews.title: Super cheap 29.52 gb card
customer_reviews.text: This 32GB SD card, as all SD cards are, is not full capacity due to preloaded essential software, formatting and functions. It's actual capacity according to my phone comes out at 29.52 GB. 2.5 GB of on boarded formatting is quite a lot, but when you've got a 32 gig card, I don't mind sacrificing a couple for the small price of this card. It also comes with a 'shoe' for you to use when plugging into a camera or computer. I bought this to extend the storage of my 32gb phone memory, and it's come in very useful. The cheapest card I found on Amazon! Fell free to ask any questions.
customer_reviews.author: Imogen

customer_reviews.title: Good price card for music - sd slot in car.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this card for music to play in my car only. I have an SD card slot and this does exactly what I needed it to with no problems whatsoever. Have used this for many months now prior to review. Lots of albumn space for me to load music up for in car use.
customer_reviews.author: rich

customer_reviews.title: Great SD card
customer_reviews.text: Not the most up-to-date I know, and each time I buy this item there is a note that pops up telling me that there is a newer version; I stick with this one as it is not fake and it a good solid reliable SD card. I don't need mega speed - what's a few more seconds writing time when something is so reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Hais

customer_reviews.title: Fast and inexpensive.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use in an SJ4000 action camera and it works a treat. It can hold about 4 hours or so of 1080p video. The micro to mini adapter is really useful too as it can plug straight into my PC. Speed seems pretty good too. Testing it on my USB 3 internal card reader on my PC and I get 84MB/s read speed and 14MB/s write when moving a huge 4Gig MOV file - not bad at all in my opinion. Hopefully it will prove to be durable - I'll come back and update this review if I have any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun H

customer_reviews.title: Not quite the full package!?
customer_reviews.text: Well this is supposed to be a 64mb card but the reality is that it's actually 59mb - not unusual with these class and size of card but none the less disappointing and perhaps in breach of trade description?! Delivery took a LONG time(!) so you need to factor that in against the good price. The card does seem to perform well and hopefully will continue to do so - never a certainty in my experience. As long as you know what you're getting and are happy with the price and actual size then you'll be satisfied with this!
customer_reviews.author: MR IAN McNAUGHTON

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable - corrupted videos, SD card errors with GoPro, dead adapters
customer_reviews.text: I've had a lot of video errors using this card in my GoPro (not even operating at 4K res). In fact, I had an entire SD card of videos that got corrupted and couldn't be repaired even with the paid tool from Grau Gmbh. Sometimes it works fine, but other times, it fails catastrophically. I've also had multiple adapters that fail, but it's hit-or-miss. Buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Card diied, no way to return.
customer_reviews.text: Card died after 6 months. Went into a read only mode. Amazon sent me a replacement, but that also failed after only a few hours whilst it was restoring all my data from Dropbox in my Sony Xperia Z3. Popped up a "Card is corrupted and needs to be re-formatted" error, but the format failed. Also tried formatting in a Windows machine and that also could not re-format it. One dud card is unlucky, two suggests some underlying problem with this model of card.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchelln

customer_reviews.title: Not 32GB
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this item for my sony xperia phone. Item arrived quickly and i am happy with this item however after putting it into my phone and not even transferring anything to it yet i have discovered that i in fact do not actually have 32GB worth of space and instead there is 28.96GB i would like to know where the other GBs are considering i have not used any memory yet to have took up the space
customer_reviews.author: Jodie Everett

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after two years of use
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for two years, then just stopped working. I had it in my Samsung phone to house some of my music collection and for storing photos and videos. Recently my phone displayed the message that my SD card had been dismounted and it's never worked since. I've tried to mount it in two Windows PCs or two other Android devices, but it's always invisible. So, this afternoon I chucked it in the bin. And the lesson? Always assume that your SD storage is temporary and always back up what's on it.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Frustratingly bad quality, short lifetime
customer_reviews.text: Bought in November 2015, started having problems in early 2016 (read: I was first stupid enough to format it as "internal" on my Moto G and had to do a factory reset), used it only as "portable storage" afterwards, because it kept misbehaving every 2 weeks. I didn't care, because dropbox backed up all my photos, and I could still put up with having to re-format often. It finally died today, and no windows, linux or android trickery would fix it, so it will find its final resting place where it always belonged: the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small, but, powerful
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these cards after seeing reviews. I use these cards 1 on my Samsung phone without any trouble, and the other on my windows10 tablet. Both were low on memory, but, now all my pictures, music and documents reside on these little, but, powerful micro cards, and the devices do not slow-down. Included adaptor makes transfer of files from the phone/tablet to the pc fantasticly easy. The read and write speed is very good compared to class4 cards.
customer_reviews.author: Doork

customer_reviews.title: This was in an mp3 player that was purchased ...
customer_reviews.text: This was in an mp3 player that was purchased for my nieces birthday.. loaded it with songs ready. recognised the card on her birthday but 2 days later crashed. reformatted and loaded songs worked until switched off then lost everything again. have tried to reformat and load but the pc always says there is an error and tries to fix without success. Have contacted the seller a few times to send back and get a replacement but no one answered yet. Maybe another Fake supplier that are finding their way onto all the market places.???
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: disappointing
customer_reviews.text: In terms of functionality and capacity the product is great. However it is stupidly temperamental! Do not drop your phone even onto a bed as the memory card corrupts and a replacement is required which makes it very frustrating if you work long hours and constantly lose your phone on your bed etc because if it falls on the floor the memory card will stop working.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Brannelly

customer_reviews.title: Great value 32GB card
customer_reviews.text: Currently at a really good price (just over £3.50) this 32G card worked well in a PC, a scanner/printer and in a car audio system. Response time was fast and not much working space was lost to formatting etc. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: jcmacc

customer_reviews.title: Item cannot be used with smart phone.
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure the item is good, and I've used it in my laptop. Unfortunately, I cannot use it for the purpose I had in mind, so currently it is redundant. I had intended to use it for media storage in my newly-acquired smart phone, but the phone will only use FAT32 format and will NOT access NTFS format, and the maximum capacity supported by FAT32 format is 32GB; hence I cannot use this micro SD card with my smart phone. If I'd known this earlier, I'd have bought a 32GB card !
customer_reviews.author: D. R. Price

customer_reviews.title: Can't Go Wrong With a Bit of Kingston!
customer_reviews.text: I always stick to Kingston where possible because I've never had any issues with any of their memory products. I've bought other high-end memory and they've eventually failed. The only reason I've ever got rid of Kingston is because it's outdated and needed upgrading, which just goes to show you how long it lasts. YEARS. I've put this in an IP Camera and it works a charm. Look no further for your memory requirements.
customer_reviews.author: Terrific Terrapin

customer_reviews.title: I was very wary about buying this product as I ...
customer_reviews.text: I was very wary about buying this product as I have read a lot of worrying reports about counterfeit sd cards on the market so I was relieved to find this appeared to be the genuine article. Of the touted 16gb storage it provided a healthy 14.9gb which, for the price, was highly satisfactory. It works perfectly in my Samsung Galaxy S5 with read/write speeds that are adequate on photo's, video's audiobooks and music. Playback on video is flawless. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Sparrow

customer_reviews.title: Good one from Kingston
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to dislike with this one. We tried it in three different Samsung phones, and it worked like a charm. We also tried it with our Mac Book Pro and a Toshiba laptop, and it worked fin there, too. The Micro SD adapter is a bit flimsy, but it works. Solid state memory prices have been tumbling for years, but right now this one is pretty good value for money. We've had many Kingston products over the years. They are generally keenly priced in the market, work well, and are reliable. We've just never had a problem with Kingston stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Austen

customer_reviews.title: It is excellently what it claims to be :)
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased no name micro SD cards in the past, only to find the maximum storage capacity was far below that written on the front of the card, so I went for a reputable brand, and well it is a Kingston 32GB sd card :D which is what I wanted :)
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Should serve my needs perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Arrived about 7 working day after I placed the order, not bad, great price, considering I was quoted 'just under £20' for a high speed 32gb card on the high street, I'm pretty sure this is high speed also. It came in perfect condition and while I haven't tested it yet, I'm almost positive I won't have any problems with this, I have a 16gb USB stick by Kingston and that works great.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. A. J. MORGAN-HAYES

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Device - Although 29GB After Formatting.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a Microsoft Surface RT (32GB) to expand the memory due to my device running out of space. The card works very well with the tablet and reads data fairly quickly although very occasionally it will take a second or two to read a directory that contains a number of files or folders. My only annoyance is that once formatted its states 29GB. This is not a total game changer but I do think companies providing electronics with storage capabilities should be more upfront about capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Empers

customer_reviews.title: better bulk buy for a long motorcycle trip
customer_reviews.text: Bought a batch of them; they're so expensive in shops; better bulk buy for a long motorcycle trip; also bought a little hard case for them, then numbered each memory card and kept a notebook of where I'd been that day on my two-week riding trip with the corresponding memory card number.
customer_reviews.author: Big Al

customer_reviews.title: Rubbish
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely rubbish. Can’t play mp4 files saved on it and many others. What’s the point? It’s maybe a flaw in the one I bought but I won’t be buying this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Keshara

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Great price for this product considering it's Kingston. This is the second time I have purchased 2 of these as the first time I got one for my wife's phone and one for mine and then we purchased a couple of tablets and ordered two more of these for our tablets. Couldn't be more happier with the price for the amount of storage space they have and it's neat they come with the SD card adapter. Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, reliable and great value
customer_reviews.text: I was dubious about buying memory cards online after hearing all the stories about false sizes and rebranding but I took the risk and bought 3 x 32gb cards. They arrived quickly, I put them in my Go Pro Hero 3 Black Edition cameras and gave them a good test - can easily read and write 4K content, have the full capacity as advertised. I will be buying more in the future - probably larger sizes too.
customer_reviews.author: James Lee

customer_reviews.title: Didt even last a year it failed
customer_reviews.text: Well after 9 months its doest work always used Kingston have load of micro cards and memory sticks from them , this 32gb and 16gb that both brought within year have failed I don't think I'll be buying them in future not to last not even a year
customer_reviews.author: Mr. P. J. Carey

customer_reviews.title: Delivery always first class. Bought this to go in ...
customer_reviews.text: Delivery always first class. Bought this to go in my wife's phone so she could take lots of pictures of the grand kids and listen to music/talking books. In fact, she now has more stuff on that than she does in her handbag!!! I for one never thought I'd see that day coming!!!
customer_reviews.author: Marc Day

customer_reviews.title: Good value and does what it says on the tin
customer_reviews.text: A useful addition (including the adapter) to the arsenal of storage hardware we all seem to require in today's 'high tech' world – don't leave home without one!
customer_reviews.author: James Edwards

customer_reviews.title: It appears to be what is advertised, a standard micro SD card.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this memory card from Amazon, because it is 32gb and will I only record audio onto it. A newer version is available but costs £10 more and has a slightly faster data rate For the application I am using it for there are no problems.
customer_reviews.author: p

customer_reviews.title: VFM and as it says on the tin!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality stuff and still in use with many re-formatting. Brand name is reliable and have bought many and in other capacities.
customer_reviews.author: Acerman

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: Had it for six weeks in my Microsoft Surface Pro and so far it has behaved flawlessly. The card is already 75% full, i use it mainly for storing and streaming data, movies and music. Also use a folder on the card as the default download directory for the Internet Download Manager program and again i have no problems to report. Reads at approx 37 Mb/s and writes at 13 Mb/s. Noticeably slower than the main SSD but that is to be expected. Overall, two thumbs up for this product.
customer_reviews.author: topazz

customer_reviews.title: Good reliable card
customer_reviews.text: Bought this card in Nov 2014 and I'm writing the review now in Dec 2017. So I've been using this card for 3 years, first in my phone and now in my camera. It has always been 100% reliable. No problems. Just what you expect from an SD card from one of the trusted manufacturers.
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: Cheap. For a reason.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely slow when placed into my Android smartphone. It does the job and stores pictures etc, but as mentioned, apps running off it are extremely slow and usually just crash. If I could go back, I'd buy a more expensive card.
customer_reviews.author: David Shane

customer_reviews.title: Kingston Micro SD 32Gb Card
customer_reviews.text: This has been working fine for a couple of months now. Haven't noticed any lag/lack of speed transferring information. Excellent value. Only one slight moan - the lock slider moves too freely. It is too easy to lock the card as it is pushed into the reader, and this loses it one star as it is annoying and it will keep happening.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Paul Henshaw

customer_reviews.title: 32gb sd card, (actually more like 30gb) with adapter
customer_reviews.text: Not 32gb, more like 30gb (1 was actually 29.2gb) took ages to arrive, 3 days late. An they dispatched 3-4days after I paid for them, but the plus side, they are easily recognised by my devices, and the adapter works fine. Good transfer speed (they should be 10speed, but more like 8) but all in all, does what you want easily!
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Kingston 32GB Micro SD memory cards cards
customer_reviews.text: Please be aware of buying this rubbish. Don't be suckered in by the low cost of there cards, as I purchased 3 of these memory cards to send photos and video clips to family members abroad. ALL 3 FAILED. Not one of the cards could be accessed by the recipients. Two of the recipients tried using different computers, but to no avail. I cannot return the cards as they are still abroad, so won't get them back for a refund. "Stick to recognised brand names".
customer_reviews.author: Bricon

customer_reviews.title: Finally a seller who sells LEGIT MicroSD cards :)
customer_reviews.text: Legit and works fine, several weeks later i can confirm this MicroSD card works perfectly with over 9gb of music and video stored and still going strong, which is awesome after i bought several fake ones from ebay actually getting a 16gb one for a brilliant price and it actually working is even better. Dont hesitate its worth the money, 16gb Micro SD card that actually works :P
customer_reviews.author: Miss Jade J. Chambers

customer_reviews.title: The one sold by amazon works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: It worked a charm in my phone ! (I had to format it in the phone first to get it working.) Im looking forward to downloading the biggest games i can find ! PS: The one sold by amazon works perfectly. Im not sure why someone complained about it. But im forced to buy another from a different unknown seller, which i obviously would trust less ! Nice work, amazon ;) (Seriously. With so many fake cards being sold, why stop selling one which we can trust to be real ?)
customer_reviews.author: BugEyedBilly

customer_reviews.title: Good value if you need extra memory (used for a smartphone)
customer_reviews.text: It was only when I started to run out of my room on my smartphone that I realised that I could use a Micro SD memory card with it. The last time I had one of these was about 4 phones ago (it was a 64GB!!). It was really easy to move my photos stored on my phone to the memory card and the adaptor means I can put it in my computer's memory card ready and transfer the photos to my PC that way. Very happy with the product - and the price
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Recommend highly for the price
customer_reviews.text: Kingston is good brand and I was looking for an authentic 32GB SD card which would not break the bank. There a lot of cheap SD cards however they may not actually be 32GB so a known brand at Class 10 is the best option. Going cheap on an SD card can be a real waste of money. Used for 1080P video filming, SD card handles this very well.
customer_reviews.author: EdgyBeer

customer_reviews.title: Great memory card for smartphone
customer_reviews.text: This is a great memory card for my HTC Desire smartphone. I originally bought a SanDisk Ultra class 10 Micro SDHC, but discovered not all memory cards are compatible with all smartphones. The SanDisk card was causing nothing but problems including the phone restarting, and files being deleted from the memory card. I read how other people were having the same problem. The Kingston card is perfect, and I have not had a single problem using this card. For compatibility with smartphones, I would highly recommended this Kingston card.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Carter

customer_reviews.title: Kingston as usual excellent and you get a product that can be used ...
customer_reviews.text: Kingston as usual excellent and you get a product that can be used in two different situations, e.g. hand held gadgets that require a mini chip and also laptops and computers, a mini chip and a full sized SD card; the reader and it is cheaper than buying a standard 32GB card, have two of these now, highly recommended will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Highland Lady

customer_reviews.title: Lasted for less than 3 years
customer_reviews.text: The card worked for less than 3 years in my Android device. Unfortunately, I cannot format this micro SD card now that I wanted to re-purpose it, I tried formatting it from various Android devices and various Windows applications without luck at all. The lifetime is a bit shorter than I have expected but it worked well when it did.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective Product and Terrible Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Purchased June 2019 but did not used until Sept 2019, Defective card. Returned product to Supplier who deny receiving return, (highly unlikely). Amazon also no assistance, although Ive never returned an item before
customer_reviews.author: Mr B

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly as intended
customer_reviews.text: This is a micro SD card. It does what it is intended for - store data. I've been using mine for months now (in my tablet) and it has functioned flawlessly. The adaptor is useful should you need to connect it to a pc or use it in, say an older digital camera that only takes full size SD cards. For reference, a micro SD card in an adaptor looks the same to a PC or other device as a full size one - it can't tell the difference.
customer_reviews.author: P. Keith

customer_reviews.title: Got a second of these as they seem genuine and ...
customer_reviews.text: Got a second of these as they seem genuine and are outstanding value for money supplied by Amazon . More than 16gb in my view only encourages you to leave all the pictures on the phone . My personal preference is to back the pictures etc onto a larger device though I do allow the free cloud to copy pictures supplied by Google and Microsoft .
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Brown

customer_reviews.title: will not fully function with legria hf 200
customer_reviews.text: This Kingston SDFC is identical externally to SDHC currently in use satisfactorily in my cannon legria hf 200 camcorder. however this will not work satisfactorily. very disapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Vaughan Cole

customer_reviews.title: Excellent 58.4GB (real) SD Card
customer_reviews.text: I have always preferred Kingston SD Cards over other makes so it was only natural to buy their larger 64GB card. I queried the difference in size as it only showed at 58.4GB which is a huge 5.6GB difference, but it seems to be correct.  Never lost that amount in a card before, this one is on loop recording as a dash cam so no worries!
customer_reviews.author: Mk3stargazer

customer_reviews.title: Decent hassle free card
customer_reviews.text: fully tested with h2testw and easily exceeds its class speed of 10mb second,(a pretty flat speed test write of 12.5mb/s) no faults on the fully tested space, and no problems fitting to samsung phone or using supplied sd adaptor to initially put the files on for said phone.. Of Course read speed is much faster, but its the write speed you buy mostly for recording of HD , in my case on a phone
customer_reviews.author: Jus

customer_reviews.title: Few issues, that may or may not have been down to the Kingston card.
customer_reviews.text: I might have got a duff one, but had all kinds of problems trying to use in a Raspberry Pi 2. Kept getting install errors. Swapped for another card and had no issues at all. Same process, but one failed, one didn't. The Kingston card worked fine in a computer and with a camera so there may be a compatability issue with the Pi. It's cheap enough that I can reuse elsewhere, but I'd probably not buy the same card again.
customer_reviews.author: Smee

customer_reviews.title: Essential for Raspberry Pi
customer_reviews.text: After browsing on Amazon for a low cost Micro SD card for the Raspberry Pi B+ I came across this Kingston 8GB Micro SD card. I purchased this because of the low price and the Kingston brand over the low cost generic/unknown branded Micro SD cards. I have been using it on the Raspberry Pi B+ with Raspbian OS for a while now and there has been no issues and there is enough storage space for what I am using it for.
customer_reviews.author: RedDragon23

customer_reviews.title: This card has not worked properly since I bought it ...
customer_reviews.text: This card has not worked properly since I bought it,but as relative newcomer to the "smartphone"world I thought it was an amateur problem.When I eventually sought professional advice it turned out to be the sd card.As the 3-5 days returns policy was well past,I am now lumbered with a duff card and quite a few pounds out of pocket!Whether this is the fault of Kingston or the supplier is debateable but "the customer is always right" or is he?
customer_reviews.author: Mr. D. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing price for 32Gb
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. I can't rate Durability until I have used it a few times (the previous 8Gb flash card, different Manufacturer, stopped being recognised after a few months sporadic use).
customer_reviews.author: Farcar

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Memory is getting really cheap. 64gb is pretty big for a phone which is what I bought it for. Especially brilliant for Android with Marshmallow version as it can combine the internal storage with external. Have been a big fan of Kingston over the years and have never come across a product of their's I did not like.
customer_reviews.author: Usman Y.

customer_reviews.title: Works fine when plugged into the PC
customer_reviews.text: Works fine when plugged into the PC. When I transfer to my new phone it doesn't connect like my 16Gb Kingston does. I cannot find out whether it's the phone software (still logged into the 16Gb SD even though I unmounted it) or whether it's the 64Gb card that's faulty. I can still use the card with the PC. Can anyone suggest a solution? 5 stars beckon
customer_reviews.author: Tripehound

customer_reviews.title: Better than the San Disk..
customer_reviews.text: I have had issues with micro sd working in smart phones, anything over 8gb normally stops working, San Disk i used to use all the time, both cards they sent me failed within a month, Kingston i know to make good PC wear and so tried this, and instantly better, even seems to be quicker to load off than the San Disk alternative. highly recommend over the over priced San Disk range.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great memory for Samsung Galaxy Tablet S2
customer_reviews.text: High quality branded memory ......... For anyone who has a Samsung Galaxy Tab S2 tablet , this memory is a great way to increase your memory capacity ...you wont need the adapter as the "mini SD " fits in the Galaxy Tab S2 tray easily and works beautifully ..Great memory at a great price !
customer_reviews.author: Bleeper24

customer_reviews.title: Simple Instalation
customer_reviews.text: Good pricing the items arrived on time well packaged, easy to install and appear to be working well have brought several of these in past and have always found them to be reliable, would recommend for anyone
customer_reviews.author: notsoshooting

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a gift,got the thumbs up,said they were perfect,I've used these in the past never had a problem, great value for money, definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: C.J

customer_reviews.title: Really good price
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a decent amount of storage. Bought 4 for ea h of our mobile phones, so no more running out of space constantly.. So far I've installed numerous apps, taken videos and countless pictures as well as downloading books to my phone and still have a huge amount of space available.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: Buy from a reputable seller
customer_reviews.text: No issues works with my gopro well. I had bought previous ones from another site and got what can only be described as excellent oozing copies. This is the real deal and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Jak

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money
customer_reviews.text: This was bought to increase the speed of a somewhat elderly Fire 7 and it has indeed done this. Not spectacularly so, but a noticeable improvement. Great value for money.
customer_reviews.author: C J Eccles

customer_reviews.title: Will they hold on and survive?
customer_reviews.text: Not had a chance to see if they will do what they are supposed to. Some cheaper items tend to fall over too quickly. A case of QED. mine are in a dash cam. Swap out and format once a week
customer_reviews.author: DIVER DES

customer_reviews.title: Samsung Galaxy Ace Mobile Phone...Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I'm not going to write a detailed review here as there are over 490 reviews already! I purchased this for my wife's Galaxy Ace mobile phone. Perfect. I put the card in and it worked immediately. Kingston is a reputable brand that I have used on many occasions before. The actual cost is the cheapest on the Amazon website, and the product itself is provided by Amazon, so you know you are getting a genuine product. Overall, I would recommend this product highly.
customer_reviews.author: AlexKrycek

customer_reviews.title: Bargain!
customer_reviews.text: A 32Gb storage card for under four quid delivered - holy cow! Total bargain, and comes with an adapter for devices needing a slot larger than a micro-SD.
customer_reviews.author: roystur

customer_reviews.title: Reliable as Ever.
customer_reviews.text: Been using this Card for a long time now, no problems, never had any with Kingston memory despite buying several cards from them over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Nick_in_Ipswich

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this sd card daily and the adaptor for veiwing on my television. At one stage I had two seasons of a top tv scifi series, 15 movies, a 3000 page pdf manual, photos and countless music videos with plenty of space to spare. I have other Kingston devices and all have proven to be excellent quality. Just one bad thing to say is that they take 4 weeks to be delivered which is ludicrous!
customer_reviews.author: C. R. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Value for Money
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Very good value for money. Got it in my phone for extra storage as my previous Samsung one became corrupt. Reading the reviews i decided to go ahead and buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Linziloo2304

customer_reviews.title: If it didn't work it would be useless, it does and well
customer_reviews.text: There is not a lot to say about such a simple object. If it didn't work it would be useless, it does and well, just as expected. Delivery was fine and early, packaging excellent and it worked well straight from the box. Got to say I have a number of Kingston products and this is as reliable as normal. I am well pleased.
customer_reviews.author: pickyvic

customer_reviews.title: Would not format with TomTom GO 5000.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work with my TomTom Go 5000. I have tried several times but the formatting process just hangs and never completes. I was able to reformat this card successfully on my Olympus camera but not on my Satnav. Funny thing is, the card I took out of my Olympus camera works fine with the satnav. Unfortunately the satnav forces a reformat of the card when first used. So, this memory card is good for some things, but NOT my TomTom Go 5000.
customer_reviews.author: Boris

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for back up storage for an mp3. It does a good job. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amethyst

customer_reviews.title: Kingston 64 gb micro sdxc Card.
customer_reviews.text: Well pleased with my 64gb sd card for my Car Dashcam....Arrived quickly, and at a great price. Thankyou Tony.
customer_reviews.author: Tony.S.K

customer_reviews.title: cards recorded well, BUT, there is a compatibility ...
customer_reviews.text: cards recorded well, BUT, there is a compatibility problem with the Samsung NX3000 camera when connecting via the USB cable - my computers (Mac Mini, PCs running Windows 7 Professional, and Windows 8.1 professional) - could not find either of the cards that I bought, I had rejected 2 camera bodies as 'faulty', but on the 3rd body, I realised the fault was with the card after I tried a Sandisk card, and that worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: oap

customer_reviews.title: Worked well until I moved it to card slot on laptop.
customer_reviews.text: This card was fine and worked well until I removed it from my Samsung Galaxy S and put it in the SD card slot on my laptop. to transfer some files. The laptop failed to recognize it as did the Samsung Galaxy when I tried to put it back. No way to fix it as I have not found any device that will recognize it since. It may be that I did something wrong when I tried to move it but I have had no problems with a Sandisk card I have used for this purpose since.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Head

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick!
customer_reviews.text: Unlike some dodgy sellers, these memory cards actually contain 16 GB of space! Bought for my sons tablet computer, all his apps are put on it and he is still no where near filling it! The converter card that comes with it makes transferring data to my laptop nice and easy too!
customer_reviews.author: Becci

customer_reviews.title: Micro SD Card
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and well packaged. Bought this to use with my TomTom. Works fine, you have to insert into the TomTom, attach TomTom to your computer then restart, it will then format for use with your TomTom. Plenty of space for updates and new maps on this tiny device. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Carmel

customer_reviews.title: Data storage card which works.
customer_reviews.text: Tiny, shiny black plastic card with gold coloured contacts on one side. Has lots of tiny writing printed on it. Can be hidden in appropriate sized slots in various electronic equipment. Its a micro SD card and it stores data - that's it really!
customer_reviews.author: D. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Camera Card
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my Safety Camera while out and about. This Card has been 100% reliable and is excellent value compared to other products available.
customer_reviews.author: michael marris

customer_reviews.title: Seems legit!
customer_reviews.text: Genuine 64GB as far as I can tell! (tested with h2testw) For a UHS-1 card, it's pretty slow though. I seem to get maybe 10MB/s write and 20MB/s read max (often the latter is closer to 10MB/s) but this might be the hardware I'm using (Toshiba Encore... which to my knowledge is UHS compatible, so it shouldn't really be a bottleneck). Still, for an approximate £25, who cares? I'm happy enough! I've mapped the SD card as a folder on the C drive, thus allowing me to install applications to it. They seem to load and work well enough. Overall assessment: groovy.
customer_reviews.author: r00x

customer_reviews.title: Has a limited life
customer_reviews.text: My 16 GB card lasted 11 months then broke... all I did was re-boot the Raspberry Pi it was in. OK, the R Pi was being used as a security cam system, 800k photos, swap file, log files... so this was an arduous duty. Whether I exceeded the number of write cycles is a moot point. Time to buy 2 more of the updated card methinks.
customer_reviews.author: Chiny

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on all laptops
customer_reviews.text: Will not work on my laptop for some reason, laptop is a year old HP.
customer_reviews.author: Damon Carter

customer_reviews.title: Where is the software to format this card as 64GB?
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was prompt. I don't think there is anything wrong with this card; just that my phone would only recognise it as a 32GB card. So I would have been better off buying a 32GB card for cheaper. I understand that it can be formatted as a 64GB card but it must be that my laptop and my phone lack the necessary software. So it's not your fault, Kingston. (My phone says it accepts up to 64GB!)
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Fade Ibitoye

product_meta.title: Kingston Technology SDCX10/64GB 64 GB micro SDXC Class 10 Flash Card with SD Card Adapter
product_meta.description:
Size Name:64 GB

Get more out of your mobile world. In capacities ranging from 4 GB - 64 GB, microSDHC/SDXC cards offer higher storage for more music, more videos, more pictures, more games - more of everything you need in the mobile world. The microSDHC and microSDXC cards allow you to maximise mobile devices. Kingston’s microSDHC/SDXC cards use a speed class rating that ensures a minimum data transfer rate for optimum performance with devices that use microSDHC/SDXC.



Note:Please always check the compatibility with manufacturer before purchasing this DRAM module. Certain motherboards may not be compatible with this product and the user should always check system compatibility on the manufacturer's website.

BOX CONTAINS
1 x MicroSDCX with Adapter.
feature_bullets: Compliant - with the SD Card Association Specification
Versatile - when combined with the adapter, can be used as a full-size SDHC/SDXC card
Compatible with micro SDHC and micro SDXC host devices, not compatible with standard micro SD-enabled devices/readers, micro SDXC cards are not compatible with micro SDHC-enabled devices/readers

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars17,635 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
